speaker: LORD
text: He can come no other way but by this hedge

speaker: LORD
text: corner. When you sally upon him, speak what terrible

speaker: LORD
text: language you will. Though you understand it

speaker: LORD
text: not yourselves, no matter. For we must not seem to

speaker: LORD
text: understand him, unless some one among us whom

speaker: LORD
text: we must produce for an interpreter.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Good captain, let me be th’ interpreter.

speaker: LORD
text: Art not acquainted with him? Knows he not thy

speaker: LORD
text: voice?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: No, sir, I warrant you.

speaker: LORD
text: But what linsey-woolsey hast thou to speak to

speaker: LORD
text: us again?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: E’en such as you speak to me.

speaker: LORD
text: He must think us some band of strangers i’ th’

speaker: LORD
text: adversary’s entertainment. Now, he hath a smack

speaker: LORD
text: of all neighboring languages. Therefore we must

speaker: LORD
text: every one be a man of his own fancy, not to know

speaker: LORD
text: what we speak one to another. So we seem to know

speaker: LORD
text: is to know straight our purpose: choughs’ language,

speaker: LORD
text: gabble enough and good enough. As for

speaker: LORD
text: you, interpreter, you must seem very politic. But

speaker: LORD
text: couch, ho! Here he comes to beguile two hours in

speaker: LORD
text: a sleep and then to return and swear the lies he

speaker: LORD
text: forges.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Ten o’clock. Within these three hours ’twill

speaker: PAROLLES
text: be time enough to go home. What shall I say I have

speaker: PAROLLES
text: done? It must be a very plausive invention that

speaker: PAROLLES
text: carries it. They begin to smoke me, and disgraces

speaker: PAROLLES
text: have of late knocked too often at my door. I find

speaker: PAROLLES
text: my tongue is too foolhardy, but my heart hath the

speaker: PAROLLES
text: fear of Mars before it, and of his creatures, not

speaker: PAROLLES
text: daring the reports of my tongue.

speaker: LORD
text: This is the first truth that e’er thine own

speaker: LORD
text: tongue was guilty of.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: What the devil should move me to undertake

speaker: PAROLLES
text: the recovery of this drum, being not ignorant

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of the impossibility and knowing I had no such

speaker: PAROLLES
text: purpose? I must give myself some hurts and say I

speaker: PAROLLES
text: got them in exploit. Yet slight ones will not carry it.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: They will say “Came you off with so little?” And

speaker: PAROLLES
text: great ones I dare not give. Wherefore? What’s the

speaker: PAROLLES
text: instance? Tongue, I must put you into a butter-woman’s

speaker: PAROLLES
text: mouth and buy myself another of

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Bajazeth’s mule if you prattle me into these perils.

speaker: LORD
text: Is it possible he should know what he is,

speaker: LORD
text: and be that he is?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I would the cutting of my garments would

speaker: PAROLLES
text: serve the turn, or the breaking of my Spanish

speaker: PAROLLES
text: sword.

speaker: LORD
text: We cannot afford you so.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Or the baring of my beard, and to say it was

speaker: PAROLLES
text: in stratagem.

speaker: LORD
text: ’Twould not do.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Or to drown my clothes and say I was

speaker: PAROLLES
text: stripped.

speaker: LORD
text: Hardly serve.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Though I swore I leapt from the window of

speaker: PAROLLES
text: the citadel—

speaker: LORD
text: How deep?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Thirty fathom.

speaker: LORD
text: Three great oaths would scarce make

speaker: LORD
text: that be believed.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I would I had any drum of the enemy’s. I

speaker: PAROLLES
text: would swear I recovered it.

speaker: LORD
text: You shall hear one anon.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: A drum, now, of the enemy’s—

speaker: LORD
text: Throca movousus, cargo, cargo,

speaker: LORD
text: cargo.

speaker: ALL
text: Cargo, cargo, cargo, villianda par corbo, cargo.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: O ransom, ransom! Do not hide mine eyes.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Boskos thromuldo boskos.

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
I
               
              know
               
              you
               
              are
               
              the
               
              Muskos’
               
              regiment
              ,

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
And
               
              I
               
              shall
               
              lose
               
              my
               
              life
               
              for
               
              want
               
              of
               
              language
              .

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
If
               
              there
               
              be
               
              here

              or

              ,

              ,

speaker: PAROLLES
text:
Italian
              ,
               
              or

              ,
               
              let
               
              him

              .

text:
I’ll
               
              discover
               
              that
               
              which
               
              shall
               
              undo
               
              the
               
              Florentine
              .

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Boskos vauvado, I understand thee and

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: can speak thy tongue. Kerelybonto, sir, betake thee

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: to thy faith, for seventeen poniards are at thy

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: bosom.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: O!

speaker:
FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: O, pray, pray, pray! Manka reuania

speaker:
FIRST

text: dulche.

              SOLDIER
text:
The

              is

              to

text:
And
              ,

              as

              ,

To

Something

O
              ,

And

Their

              .

Which
               
              you

FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: But wilt thou faithfully?

speaker: PAROLLES

FIRST
               
              SOLDIER
text: Acordo linta. Come on, thou art

text: granted space.

Go

We

speaker: LORD

Till

Captain
